intro: Leontodon maroccanus, commonly known as the Moroccan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North Africa, particularly Morocco. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, typical of the genus Leontodon. The species is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging ecological conditions.
